translated: and I was known as Kesava;
to learn about what is skillful and unskillful.
the Great Seer who sees what is beneficial;
the one with vision teaching the Dhamma.
Having delighted in my own mind,
placing my head at his feet,
I paid homage to the Teacher
I was a king, a lord of the land,
